newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - Sept 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - Sept 30.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Former Moslem rebel chief Nur Misuari is taking his oath today as the third governor of the Autonomous Region in Moslem Mindanao.

- Representative Jaime Lopez, House foreign affairs committee chairman, says he will file a resolution calling for an inquiry to determine whether the U.S. government has the legal right to a 10.6-hectare property in Fort Bonifacio.

- The National Bureau of Investigation is not going to investigate allegations of a cover-up by a lawmaker in connection with a rape complaint filed by an 11-year old girl. But it said it would continue to press the original complaint.
- President Fidel Ramos orders an investigation into reports that the contractor of a mass-housing project along railway tracks ignored safety measures in the original design.

- National Economic and Development Authority director-general Cielito Habito says he expects inflation in September to dip to between 5.0 to 6.0 percent as prices of basic commodities have remained stable.
- The International Monetary Fund urges the government to increase its capital expenditure to provide for vital infrastructure projects.

- The Senate ways and means committee approves a three-tiered specific tax system for beer and cigarettes which will give the government an additional revenues of 7.5 billion pesos to 14.3 billion pesos in the next three years.
